The barricades close, as does the door to the room; when you begin the battle, a blue wire-frame field flashes across your body. The capsule rises up in front of you, and opens, depositing a staff-wielding dummy into the middle of the ring before retreating back into the ground. It assumes a fighting stance, defending as you draw your weapon.

You weapon can be wielded with one or both hands, which leaves you in a slightly awkward place. You don't notice much of a difference until you take it in two; it seems comparatively more stable now, and you imagine you could muster a much more damaging swing now. You take a tentative overhead swing toward the dummy, slowing down as you come within proximity; it raises the staff horizontally, and there's a resonant 'tap' as your weapons softly rebound against one another.

You withdraw, and it assumes a neutral stance.

Alright, this time for real.
